It should be said Zhang Lu, but the character is mistaken.
He was originally Fan Sui, a person from Wei.
He first served in Wei, and was sent to Qi with the senior minister Su Jia.
Qi considered Sui to be wise, and privately rewarded him with gold, jade, and cattle and wine. Su Jia was jealous and angry with him.

Wei and Qi were greatly enraged, pulled him by the sides, broke his teeth, rolled him up in a mat, and abandoned him in a latrine.
Sui did not die, and a privy cleaner brought him out.
After Sui was saved, he changed his name to Zhang Lu, and followed Qin's envoy Wang Ji to Qin to see King Zhao.
King Zhao was delighted with him, appointed him as a guest minister, and gradually promoted him to chancellor.
Later, Su Jia became Qin's envoy, and Sui then went out on foot in plain clothes.
Jia saw him and was greatly surprised, and asked Sui:
Have you also told Qin?
Sui said:
A fugitive only escapes death, how dare I tell Qin?
He also asked Sui:
Does the Qin chancellor Zhang Junzi know about this?
Sui said:
The main person can also get close.
Jia said:
Now I want to ask Zhang Junzi to meet him.
Then they went together.
When he got off the carriage, the gatekeeper was startled and straightened his expression, which made Jia suspicious.
Sui entered and did not come out.
Jia asked the gatekeeper and found out that he was the Qin chancellor, so he paled with fear and terror, took off his hat and bared his chest, and invited him in to apologize for his crime.
Sui then counted his offenses and pardoned him.
When Jia sent him back, Sui said:
Report to the Wei lord for me and order him to execute Wei Qi;
